New_Orleans.Xavier University Main Building, Convent:
Xavier University Main Building, Convent and Library is a National Register of Historic Places listing for three late Gothic Revival architecture style buildings on the campus of Xavier University of Louisiana in New Orleans. The buildings are a three-story main building built in 1932, a two-and-a-half story convent built in 1932, and a two-story library built in 1937.


== Details ==
The three buildings, fronted by Drexel Drive, represent the original buildings of the Xavier campus, following the campus' move from the Xavier University Preparatory School/St.
